title: His mother had always taught him
body: His mother had always taught him not to ever think of himself as better than others. He'd tried to live by this motto. He never looked down on those who were less fortunate or who had less money than him. But the stupidity of the group of people he was talking to made him change his mind.

title: Walking through forgotten streets
body: He wandered through narrow streets once full of laughter. Now only silence remained, echoing stories no one remembered anymore.

title: The abandoned journal
body: In the attic, she found a journal with cracked leather. Dust covered its secrets, but every word inside pulsed with life.

title: Cracks in the concrete
body: Even the strongest walls can crack under pressure. He learned this the hard way in both life and architecture.

title: Shadows in the woods
body: The deeper she walked into the woods, the more the shadows felt alive. Watching. Whispering. Waiting.
